permissionsPage.title: Permissions
permissionsPage.aboutPermissionsDesc1: Permissions control how much autonomy your agent has. In Explore mode, the agent can only read and research — perfect for understanding a problem before committing to changes. When you're ready, switch to Execute mode to let the agent implement the plan autonomously.
permissionsPage.aboutPermissionsDesc2: A good workflow: start in Explore to let the agent investigate, review the proposed plan, then execute with confidence.
permissionsPage.defaultPermissionsDesc: App-level patterns allowed in Explore mode. Commands not on this list are blocked.
permissionsPage.workspaceCustomizationsDesc: Workspace-level patterns that extend the app defaults above.
permissionsPage.customPermissionsPath: Create a permissions.json file in your workspace to add custom rules.

labelsPage.title: Labels
labelsPage.aboutLabelsDesc1: Labels help you organize sessions with colored tags. Use them to categorize conversations by project, topic, or priority — making it easy to filter and find related sessions later.
labelsPage.aboutLabelsDesc2: Each label can optionally carry a value with a specific type (text, number, or date). This turns labels into structured metadata — for example, a "priority" label with value 3, or a "due" label with a date.
labelsPage.aboutLabelsDesc3: Auto-apply rules assign labels automatically when a message matches a regex pattern. For example, pasting a Linear issue URL can auto-tag the session with the project name and issue ID — no manual tagging needed.
labelsPage.labelHierarchyDesc: All labels configured for this workspace. Labels can be nested to form groups.
labelsPage.noLabelsHint: Labels can be created by the agent or by editing labels/config.json in your workspace.
labelsPage.autoApplyRulesDesc: Regex patterns that automatically apply labels when matched in user messages. For example, paste a Linear issue URL and automatically tag the session with the project name and issue ID.
